entities.description: Criminal homicide through murder or nonnegligent manslaughter.
Homicide through negligent actions.
Homicide considered to be legally justified.
Unlawful seizure or carrying away of a person by force.
Sexual intercourse compelled by force or threat, against the will of the victim.
Engaging in sodomy against the will of the victim.
Sexual assault involving penetration with an object.
Indecent liberties or child molesting through fondling.
Taking property from a person by force or threat of force.
Attack with intent to cause severe injury, often involving a weapon.
Assault that does not involve significant physical injury.
Placing someone in fear of bodily harm without physical attack.
Malicious burning of property.
Obtaining money or property through threats of violence or other harm.
Illegal entry into a building for the purpose of committing a crime.
Stealing from a person's pocket or purse.
Grabbing a purse or bag from someone.
Stealing goods from a retail establishment.
Stealing property from within a building.
Stealing from a machine where money is inserted.
Stealing property from a motor vehicle.
Stealing components or accessories of a motor vehicle.
Various other forms of theft not classified under specific categories.
Stealing or attempting to steal a motor vehicle.
Illegal replication or alteration of documents or money.
Obtaining property through deception or trickery.
Fraud involving credit cards or ATM transactions.
Assuming someone else's identity for fraudulent purposes.
Providing false information to obtain welfare benefits.

relationships.description: Indicates that a crime was committed by a person.
Indicates that a crime was reported in the survey.
Defines the type of crime that was committed.
Indicates that a crime involves a victim.
Indicates the time period during which the crime was recorded.
Indicates the location where the crime occurred.
